Not sure exactly where to log this.
I am having a problem restarting eclipse on Windows Vista Beta 2.
Deleting everything in eclipse\configuration (except for config.ini) lets me 
keep working.
Feel free to drop by my office if you need to reproduce the problem, or test a 
fix.

Here is my command line:
C:\eclipse\eclipse.exe -clean -vm C:\jdks\jdk1.4.2_06\jre\bin\javaw.exe 
-vmargs -Xmx256M

Please attach the files contained in the 
directory "org.eclipse.core.runtime\.manager" of your configuration when this 
failure occurs.  There should be one or more .filetable.* files and possibly 
a .fileTableLock file in this directory.  Thanks.

OK, here are the files from configuration\org.eclipse.core.runtime\.manager 
following a failed restart. I will also attach the corresponding 
configuration\1130369195339.log file, in case that is useful.

FYI, while trying to get these files for you, I managed to successfully 
restart eclipse 3 times in a row. Then I decided to reboot the OS, and eclipse 
failed to restart on the first try. It's possible that the failure only occurs 
after the system has been rebooted. If you need to know for sure, let me know, 
and I will do some more testing for you.

Created an attachment (id=28822)
Zip of files in runtime\.manager directory

Created an attachment (id=28823)
.log file for same failure as above attached ,manager files

I have an IBM "NetVista" ;) desktop with Intel P4 2.53GHz, 756M RAM.
The hard drive (C:) is an "ST340014A ATA" 37G hard drive, file system: NTFS.
I do not have any other machine with Windows Vista - this is it.

The Java VM is jre 1.4.2_06 from Sun.

Sorry, no log file, so no errors when files were created.

True, Windows Vista may have a file caching problem - it is still in beta.
A Google of "Vista build 5231 file caching" gives 30,000 hits - yoiks.
Here's a quote from: http://www.cooltechzone.com/index.php?
option=content&task=view&id=1853&Itemid=0&limit=1&limitstart=2

"The better feature here is an integrated Shadow Copy Client, which can be 
enabled from the HDD?s Properties dialog box. The concept is that the OS 
caches older versions of your files, so if an important file gets corrupted, 
or gets overwritten with an unfinished version, you simply go to the file?s 
properties and choose the needed version from the Previous Versions pane. You 
get multiple versions that you can restore from, which make this feature a 
handy tool for human errors."

Looking at my hard drive's Properties dialog, I see the new "Previous 
Versions" tab, which I will attach below. I don't see a place to 
disable/enable this feature, but it would appear to be "on", given that I seem 
to have some "previous versions" to choose from.

It sounds to me like you might want to just wait on this until after I get a 
new build (maybe a few months). I have an acceptable work-around, and I am 
probably one of the very few people running eclipse on Vista at this time.

If you like, you can cc yourself on bug 78839 so that you know when I have 
upgraded. Of course, if this is still a problem, I will add a comment here <g>.

Created an attachment (id=28856)
The new "Previous Versions" tab in the hard drive's Properties dialog
Carolyn, are you still seeing this problem?  Need to understand this for 3.2 I think.

Created an attachment (id=38193)
Zip of whole configuration directory

Yes, I still see this. Only happens on reboot, as far as I can tell.
(I'll try logout without shutdown in a minute).
I am now running I20060331-2000 (M6).
I've attached a zip of the entire eclipse\configuration directory, in case that helps any.

Does not happen on a simple 'logout'. So it's something that the OS is doing on shutdown (or restart).

Please let me know if there is anything you would like me to try.

Apparently, there's a February CTP of Vista available. I'll upgrade to that and try it. It will take a few days, maybe a week... I need Infra to do it for me because I don't have a DVD burner, and it is way easier to just reformat the partition and install from scratch.

FYI, "CTP" is "Community Tech Preview". MS is releasing CTP's now instead of Betas for Vista. They're not supposed to be as stable, but they happen more often. Anyhow, maybe this is just some strange disk-caching problem, like I mentioned in comment 6, and maybe the problem will magically go away if I run the newer Vista.
Carolyn, any news on this front?
I will give this a try here also for RC3.

Sorry for not getting back to you earlier, Pascal, Thomas.
I am waiting for our Infra team to burn a DVD of the February CTP of Vista. They are pretty busy, and they seem to be having some trouble with the DVD burner only working at single-speed, but I am told that it should be ready today. If it is, I will have an answer for you by tomorrow.

I have a DVD with February CTP of Vista and a machine in Austin to try out also.  Carolyn please proceed with your tests when you get it set up.  I would like this to be tried on more than one machine.  Thanks.

I reproduced on build 5308 of Vista.  This has to be an OS problem.  It only occurs if you reboot.  I verified that the files that cause the problem (in .manager folder) have the correct information when they are first created, but when the OS is rebooted then the files are the correct length but the last 4 bytes have been changed to zeros.  This is pretty scary thing for a file system to do.  Carolyn do you have any way to open a bug against MicroSoft for this?  I can probably get a small testcase put together that runs on the Sun VM.
Vista is a long ways out still.  There is nothing we can do right now for 3.2.  Moving to 3.2.1 to remind us to investigate on a later build of Vista in the 3.2.1 timeframe.

I finally got my Vista 5308 machine back yesterday. It was waiting on "Norton Anti-Virus for Vista". We were finally able to convince some people that we needed the machine right away, and we can install anti-virus programs later...

FYI, the problem (or a similar one?) just happened for me without a reboot.
I ran eclipse for several hours yesterday to do some testing for bug 78839, and I left it running overnight. I just now began looking at this bug, and after I exited eclipse, I decided to see if I could first restart without rebooting. I can't. Slightly different stack trace: NumberFormatException in org.eclipse.osgi.storagemanager.StorageManager.updateTable. I will zip up the whole config directory for you.

The problem is very repeatable - I can get it to fail on about 7 out of 10 restarts. I'm not sure, but I believe I had a successful restart every time I exited with an unfinished background operation (initializing java tooling, building workspace, ...) - if that makes any sense. Not sure if the files are written differently in that case.

For the record, I can't restart eclipse after rebooting Vista, either.
Same stack trace as comment 19.

As for how to report it to Microsoft - are you an MSDN member?
Note that we tried using the "Feedback" program that shows up on the Vista desktop, and our bug report was never sent. Might have been a firewall problem, I don't know, but we tried several times and then gave up.

I have the same problem. Last I shutdown my Windows with ShutDown button :-) and then I couldn't start my eclipse any more. After reading this bug I replaced my .fileTable file with the same file of my buddy. And its working now.

Thanks.

log back in, restart eclipse = no problem.

Felipe, you need to restart eclipse 10 times in a row without rebooting,

Andy and Richard, are you absolutely sure you are running Vista build 5384?
(i.e. the full Beta 2 of Vista, NOT the CTP's that led up to Beta 2)
Also, when you installed Beta 2, did you reformat your hard drive and install from scratch? (We did). Microsoft had some warning in one of their build notes that this was the best way to install this stuff - particularly if you were using the CTP's that came before the beta.

Andy, I am not certain that your 'big problem' is exactly the same as this, but it could be a clue because it seems similar. Maybe Thomas can have a look at your eclipse configuration files right after the problem happens - see comment 1 from Thomas for details.

Hi !

I added two new bug for this problem (since you said that this bug will be closed):
152248 = Azureus doesn't restart after close on Vista
152129 = Tabs problem on Vista (with Azureus)

You are probably wondering why I am listing both of them here. Restart problem occurs ONLY if you create categories (which should create Categories Tabs, which trigers cannot set enabled state). So if you start Azureus and stop it and start it you can do it, but if you create category and triger 152129 bug, then restart of Azureus fails.

I have tried this with SWT 3.1 and also with SWT 3.2. There is test version of Azureus available which now supports SWT 3.2, but bug is still there. 

So it seems that when we fix bug 152129, this restart problem will be fixed.

Andy
slipping to 3.3.  Work to support vista is going on in the 3.3 development cycle.
Now that a new version of vist is out, could people that have noticed problems try again and report. thx.
